name: Escape the Fate
description:
'''Escape the Fate''' is an American [[Rock music|rock]] band from [[Las Vegas Valley|Las Vegas]], [[Nevada]], formed in 2004. Originally from [[Pahrump, Nevada]], the group currently consists of lead vocalist [[Craig Mabbitt]], guitarists Matti Hoffman, Erik Jensen, TJ Bell, and drummer Robert Ortiz. Ortiz is the only founding member remaining in the band.

The band released their debut album ''[[Dying Is Your Latest Fashion]]'' in 2006, fronted by founding lead singer [[Ronnie Radke]]. After Radke was sentenced to prison for his involvement in a 2006 killing, he was fired and replaced with [[Craig Mabbitt]] formerly of the band [[Blessthefall]]. Escape the Fate's second album ''[[This War Is Ours]]'', their first with Mabbitt, was released in 2008 and debuted at No. 35 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], selling 13,000 copies in the first week. 

Their third album, ''[[Escape the Fate (album)|Escape the Fate]]'', came out in 2010 and reached No. 25 on the ''Billboard'' 200, their highest placement. In 2013, their fourth album ''[[Ungrateful (album)|Ungrateful]]'' was released, including "One for the Money", their highest-charting song on the U.S. [[Mainstream Rock (chart)|Mainstream Rock]] charts.

Currently signed to [[John Feldmann]]'s Big Noise label, the band's seventh album ''[[Chemical Warfare (Escape the Fate album)|Chemical Warfare]]'' was released in 2021, and their eighth and most recent album ''[[Out of the Shadows (Escape the Fate album)|Out of the Shadows]]'' was released in 2023.
